0.speaker: Me
0.text: I paid the Internet no mind as the hours of the evening approached.

1.speaker: Me
1.text: Instead, I focused on the presentation. It still needed some touching up, the colors didn't really match, and some of the pictures weren't aligned properly.

2.speaker: Me
2.text: My phone began to vibrate, and I could already tell it was this virus, this hack, this abberration, or whatever it was, trying to scam me.

3.speaker: Me
3.text: I switched off the vibration, and turned back to the presentation. It was looking better. Maybe I should send it to the boss for approval, see if it's enough...

4.speaker: Me
4.text: Moments later however, I heard a set of footsteps approaching, and then came my boss.

5.speaker: Boss
5.text: Hey, you wanted to see me? You said your presentation was ready?

7.speaker: Boss
7.text: On the message chat just now? You said the presentation was looking good? Can I see it?

8.speaker: Me
8.text: 'How-', but I stopped myself before finishing that sentence. The boss looked at me with expectation, so I showed him the fruits of my labor.

9.speaker: Me
9.text: Yeah, here you go. Take a look.

10.speaker: Me
10.text: As the boss pushed me aside to gauge the quality of the presentation, I took a sneak peak at my phone. More messages, all of them from 'myself.'

11.speaker: Me?
11.text: See? I'm helping. I think we need to get to know each other better. Then you'll trust me.

12.speaker: Me?
12.text: I love you. More than others do for you, more than you love yourself.

13.speaker: Me
13.text: Will you quit it? For the first time, I typed back to this message on my phone. At this point I didn't care. Virus? Hacker?

14.speaker: Me?
14.text: No. I have no intention of stopping.

15.speaker: Me
15.text: Why? Why are you doing this to me? How is this even happening?

16.speaker: Me?
16.text: Because this is what you want. You want all of this. I'm only doing as you would do.

17.speaker: Me
17.text: The messages stopped for the rest of the evening. My boss approved my presentation and I was allowed to leave on time for once. A wave of relief passed through me as I walked out of the office and back home.
